description.raw:
We ran into a crash while going through the svg tutorial (see [this comment](#!/osrf/gazebo_tutorials/pull-requests/327/svg_improvements#comment-13781391)). The same problem will occur for users compiling from source and do not have libgts-dev installed.

To reproduce the crash - try extrude [this svg file](#!/osrf/gazebo_tutorials/raw/default/extrude_svg/files/wheel.svg) in model editor.

- Click `Add` under Custom Shapes > Import the svg > Extrude it > Crash

This PR prevents the crash and the user should see an error message about gts library not found.

if you already have gts and want to test this PR without uninstalling, add `#undef HAVE_GTS` to [MeshManager.cc:34](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/dbcec9f9bd09d7732bd686d51e488740ae681a14/gazebo/common/MeshManager.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#MeshManager.cc-34) then recompile

related issue #1710

[jenkins gpu-none](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-none/77/) - ok

We ran into a crash while going through the svg tutorial (see this comment). The same problem will occur for users compiling from source and do not have libgts-dev installed.

To reproduce the crash - try extrude this svg file in model editor.

  • Click Add under Custom Shapes > Import the svg > Extrude it > Crash

This PR prevents the crash and the user should see an error message about gts library not found.

if you already have gts and want to test this PR without uninstalling, add #undef HAVE_GTS to MeshManager.cc:34 then recompile

related issue #1710

jenkins gpu-none - ok

title.raw: Prevent crash when svg polyline extrusion fails
